reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are clean but definitely showing ware - lots of scrapes, missing hooks in washroom, caulking slapped on on tiles and not professionally finished. The heat in the room was broken. As soon as we mentioned it, they brought up a space heater which did the trick. Also, requested ice was brought immediately. The bed is really comfortable, good size bathroom with good quality towels. Ridiculous to have to pay for internet - and the rate of charge even more ridiculous. Didn't try the bar or restaurant. No breakfast included in our rate. The location is wonderful. This is not a 4 star as it is billed on several sites. I would say a good 3 star. Given other options in the area that do offer breakfast and in some cases internet for around the same price, I would likely not return to the Parkcity. Our rate per night, with tax was 99 GBP.
reviews.title: average place - would never pay full price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we recently stayed at the parkcity for one night while in london to see a theatre show. the location of the hotel was convenient as it was only a 5-10 min walk away from the nearest tube station. it's also located in a quiet street which meant a peaceful night's sleep. the staff were professional and polite, while the rooms were very clean and spacious.
reviews.title: great hotel, great value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: the only minor complaint is that our room had a tv with a partially functioning remote (volume buttons had decided not to work). the continental breakfast that was included in the price was limited in terms of selection, but plentiful in supply.
reviews.title: modern clean well-located

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled on business
reviews.text: however, these complaints are only minor when compared to the overall great value that this hotel offers.
reviews.title: Great Value for London.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a modern, well-maintained and clean hotel. The location is convenient, and good value for London - the price displayed at the reception desk was double the price we had paid by booking a few weeks earlier online.
reviews.title: Great modern hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We loved our week there -in a BIG, very quiet room with a HUGE bathroom. The extras such as terry robes and slippers, the fridge with chocolates and water, the morning paper, etc. were great. The staff is unobtrusive but helpful. The continental breakfast is sufficient. The location was terrific for us.
reviews.title: a gem of a little hotel with great rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were in London for a concert at the Albert Hall and so chose this hotel based on its location and the great reviews here on Tripadvisor. I've never had a problem with any hotel which score highly here but this was about to end.
reviews.title: Great location, truly awful service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled on business
reviews.text: We had stopped the night before at relatives just outside London and so travelled in early to make the most of the day. As a result we arrived at 11.30am.
reviews.title: Spotlessly clean and the best beds in the entire world

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled on business
reviews.text: The front desk informed us that check in was 3pm and there was no room ready, they could call housekeeping to see if they could do anything or we could leave our bags and do some sightseeing.
reviews.title: Great location, quiet clean rooms.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: No problem with that, bit late for a check in time but hey ho.
reviews.title: Great location, lovely street

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked Parkcity for my girlfriends birthday. Overall it was pretty disppointing. The hotel is full of awards from 2008...but I suspect things have gone downhill a bit since then. It's worth me adding that I do not stay at many 4-5* hotels and I do not really have exacting standards but there were a few issues which, for the money, were not good.
reviews.title: Disappointed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: Good points - location was great and front desk staff were proffessional and friendly. Bed was massive - and about the most comfortable I have ever slept in. The hotel was quiet to the outside world. The room and hotel generally was clean but is looking a bit tatty and peeling in places. The qaulity of food at breakfast (when it eventually came) was very good.
reviews.title: Good but hot

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Not so good - Room was very cold, heating did not work. Breakfast was an absolute farce with most of the food running out and a wait of an hour for a fully cooked breakfast - shocking service - really really bad. It was included in our room rate so I'll not push it too far but safe to say if I had actually paid for breakfast the standard rate (a whopping £19 per person) I would have made some serious complaints...and I hate complaining. The qaulity of the food we did get was very good...it's just that it was only half of what the hotel claimed to offer and the staff were way over stretched...basically it was shambolic. Check out was not smooth as although I had pre-paid the room it seems on arrival I had been charged again (although the staff picked up on this before I did to be fair). Generally the hotel is looking a bit tatty in places, with peeling wall paper and marks, breakages etc...but OK, nothing more. 3* at best I'd say,
reviews.title: Great Hidden Gem!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I am sure a while a go this was a good value and decent hotel, but from my experience I could not recommend it, sadly.
reviews.title: Great Little Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Hotel was nice, very clean, quiet and not too far from the station. Staff was friendly and cooperative but they had to change our room twice as the heating system was broken and the place stifling hot. They really ought to add a temperature gauge to their thermostats so that one can decide at what temperature to set the room.
reviews.title: Fantastic value!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I chose the hotel, as the review was good. I like the room which is quite big as London hotel. The hotel located between Earls Court and Gloucester Road. There are two supermarket near the hotel. And many restaurant around Earls Court.
reviews.title: quite good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel service was quite good. The receptionist Jaroslaw was very helpful.
reviews.title: As good as we remembered

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was good. There were really good bread for British standard. And staffs were great.
reviews.title: A spacious room in London at reasonable price!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The downside were
reviews.title: Overall Good Place - Nice Room and Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - some of receptionist was really hopeless. does not know anything and not willing to help.
reviews.title: Nice hotel let down by bad service - disappointed.
